CARDINAL . DATE a delegation from the ORG visited GPE . During that visit the delegation looked into various issues arising from the new governmental policy of intercepting at sea , and returning to GPE , migrants approaching GPE ’s southern maritime border . In particular , the delegation focused on the system of safeguards in place to ensure that no one was sent to a country where there were substantial grounds for believing that he or she would run a real risk of being subjected to torture or ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . In its report , made public on DATE , the ORG expressed the opinion that GPE ’s policy of intercepting migrants at sea and obliging them to return to GPE or other non - NORP countries violated the principle of non - refoulement . The ORG emphasised that GPE was bound by the principle of non - refoulement wherever it exercised its jurisdiction , which included via its personnel and vessels engaged in border protection or rescue at sea , even when operating outside its territory . Moreover , all persons coming within GPE ’s jurisdiction should be afforded an appropriate opportunity and facilities to seek international protection . The information available to the ORG indicated that no such opportunity or facilities were afforded to the migrants intercepted at sea by the NORP authorities during the period examined . On the contrary , the persons who were pushed back to GPE in the operations carried out from DATE were denied the right to obtain an individual assessment of their case and effective access to the refugee - protection system . In that connection , the ORG observed that persons surviving a sea voyage were particularly vulnerable and often not in a condition in which they should be expected to declare immediately their wish to apply for asylum .

According to the ORG report , GPE could not be considered a safe country in terms of human rights and refugee law ; the situation of persons arrested and detained in GPE , including that of migrants – who were also exposed to being deported to other countries – indicated that the persons pushed back to GPE were at risk of ill - treatment .
